title: Mastering Comparatives and Superlatives
purpose: To help learners understand and correctly use comparative and superlative adjectives in English, including special cases.

questions.question: Choose the correct comparative form: My car is ______ than yours. (fast)
questions.explanation: For most one-syllable adjectives, add '-er' to form the comparative.

questions.question: Choose the correct superlative form: Everest is the ______ mountain in the world. (high)
questions.explanation: For most one-syllable adjectives, add '-est' to form the superlative.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: This book is ______ than that one. (interesting)
questions.explanation: For adjectives with two or more syllables, use 'more' for the comparative.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: She is the ______ student in the class. (intelligent)
questions.explanation: For adjectives with two or more syllables, use 'most' for the superlative.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the correct comparative form? (good)
choices: He is more good than me.
questions.explanation: 'Good' has an irregular comparative form: 'better'.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the correct superlative form? (bad)
choices: That was the most bad day.
questions.explanation: 'Bad' has an irregular superlative form: 'worst'.

questions.question: Choose the correct form: My new phone is ______ than my old one. (expensive)
questions.explanation: 'Expensive' is a multi-syllable adjective, so use 'more'.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: This is the ______ movie I've ever seen. (boring)
questions.explanation: 'Boring' is a multi-syllable adjective, so use 'most'.

questions.question: Which adjective forms its comparative and superlative irregularly? (far)
questions.explanation: 'Far' has irregular forms: 'farther/further' (comparative) and 'farthest/furthest' (superlative).

questions.question: Complete the sentence: She is ______ than her sister. (pretty)
questions.explanation: For adjectives ending in '-y', change 'y' to 'i' and add '-er'.

questions.question: Choose the correct superlative form: He is the ______ player on the team. (strong)
questions.explanation: 'Strong' is a one-syllable adjective, so add '-est'.

questions.question: Which of these is a special case for comparatives? (simple)
questions.explanation: Adjectives ending in '-le' often just add '-r' (simpler) or '-st' (simplest) if they are two syllables.

questions.question: Identify the correct comparative form: This puzzle is ______ than the last one. (difficult)
questions.explanation: 'Difficult' is a multi-syllable adjective, so use 'more'.

questions.question: Which of these is the superlative form of 'little' (meaning amount)?
questions.explanation: 'Little' (meaning amount) has irregular forms: 'less' (comparative) and 'least' (superlative).

questions.question: Complete the sentence: That was the ______ decision I've ever made. (wise)
questions.explanation: For adjectives ending in '-e', just add '-st'.

questions.question: Choose the correct comparative form: My new job is ______ than my old one. (stressful)
questions.explanation: 'Stressful' is a multi-syllable adjective, so use 'more'.

questions.question: Which sentence is grammatically correct? (heavy)
choices: This box is heavyer than that one.
This box is more heavy than that one.
This box is heavier than that one.
This box is heaviest than that one.
questions.explanation: For adjectives ending in '-y', change 'y' to 'i' and add '-er'.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: He is the ______ runner in the race. (fast)
questions.explanation: 'Fast' is a one-syllable adjective, so add '-est'.

questions.question: Which adjective can be both regular and irregular in its comparative form? (clever)
questions.explanation: 'Clever' can be 'cleverer' or 'more clever' (and 'cleverest' or 'most clever').

questions.question: Choose the correct superlative form: This is the ______ cake I've ever tasted. (delicious)
questions.explanation: 'Delicious' is a multi-syllable adjective, so use 'most'.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: Her hair is ______ than mine. (long)
questions.explanation: 'Long' is a one-syllable adjective, so add '-er'.

questions.question: Which of these is the comparative form of 'much/many'?
questions.explanation: 'Much' and 'many' have irregular forms: 'more' (comparative) and 'most' (superlative).

questions.question: Identify the correct superlative form: He is the ______ person I know. (kind)
questions.explanation: 'Kind' is a one-syllable adjective, so add '-est'.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: This exercise is ______ than the previous one. (easy)
questions.explanation: For adjectives ending in '-y', change 'y' to 'i' and add '-er'.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the correct superlative form? (good)
choices: She is the most good singer.
questions.explanation: 'Good' has an irregular superlative form: 'best'.

questions.question: Choose the correct comparative form: The new building is ______ than the old one. (modern)
questions.explanation: 'Modern' is a multi-syllable adjective, so use 'more'.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: This is the ______ story I've ever heard. (sad)
questions.explanation: For one-syllable adjectives ending in consonant-vowel-consonant, double the last consonant and add '-est'.

questions.question: Which of these is an example of an adjective that uses 'more' for its comparative form? (careful)
questions.explanation: 'Careful' is a multi-syllable adjective, so use 'more'.

questions.question: Identify the correct comparative form: He looks ______ today than yesterday. (happy)
questions.explanation: For adjectives ending in '-y', change 'y' to 'i' and add '-er'.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: This is the ______ dress in the store. (beautiful)
questions.explanation: 'Beautiful' is a multi-syllable adjective, so use 'most'.

questions.question: Which adjective has two possible comparative forms? (common)
questions.explanation: Some two-syllable adjectives (e.g., common, handsome, polite, quiet, simple) can use either '-er/-est' or 'more/most'.

questions.question: Choose the correct superlative form: She is the ______ member of the family. (old)
questions.explanation: 'Old' can have 'older/oldest' (general) or 'elder/eldest' (for family members, particularly siblings).

questions.question: Complete the sentence: The traffic was ______ than usual. (bad)
questions.explanation: 'Bad' has an irregular comparative form: 'worse'.

questions.question: Which of these uses the superlative form correctly? (thin)
choices: He is the more thin person.
He is the most thin person.
questions.explanation: For one-syllable adjectives ending in consonant-vowel-consonant, double the last consonant and add '-est'.

questions.question: Identify the correct comparative form: This chair is ______ than that one. (comfortable)
questions.explanation: 'Comfortable' is a multi-syllable adjective, so use 'more'.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: That was the ______ experience of my life. (exciting)
questions.explanation: 'Exciting' is a multi-syllable adjective, so use 'most'.

questions.question: Which adjective can take both -er/-est and more/most? (polite)
questions.explanation: Some two-syllable adjectives (e.g., polite) can use either form.

questions.question: Choose the correct superlative form: It's the ______ idea he's ever had. (brilliant)
questions.explanation: 'Brilliant' is a multi-syllable adjective, so use 'most'.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: My brother is ______ than me. (tall)
questions.explanation: 'Tall' is a one-syllable adjective, so add '-er'.

questions.question: Which of these is the comparative form of 'ill' (meaning sick)?
questions.explanation: 'Ill' has an irregular comparative form: 'worse' (similar to 'bad').

questions.question: Identify the correct comparative form: The weather is ______ today than yesterday. (cold)
questions.explanation: 'Cold' is a one-syllable adjective, so add '-er'.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: This is the ______ book on my shelf. (old)
questions.explanation: 'Old' is a one-syllable adjective, so add '-est'.

questions.question: Which of these is the superlative form of 'far' (meaning distance)?
questions.explanation: 'Far' has irregular forms: 'farther/further' (comparative) and 'farthest/furthest' (superlative).

questions.question: Choose the correct comparative form: Her voice is ______ than mine. (loud)
questions.explanation: 'Loud' is a one-syllable adjective, so add '-er'.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: That was the ______ performance of the night. (amazing)
questions.explanation: 'Amazing' is a multi-syllable adjective, so use 'most'.

questions.question: Which adjective needs to double its final consonant in the comparative and superlative forms? (big)
questions.explanation: One-syllable adjectives ending in consonant-vowel-consonant (e.g., big, hot, thin) double the final consonant.

questions.question: Identify the correct superlative form: He is the ______ doctor in the hospital. (experienced)
questions.explanation: 'Experienced' is a multi-syllable adjective, so use 'most'.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: This new restaurant is ______ than the old one. (popular)
questions.explanation: 'Popular' is a multi-syllable adjective, so use 'more'.

questions.question: Which of these is a special case where 'less' is used for the comparative? (little - meaning size)
questions.explanation: 'Little' (meaning size) typically uses 'littler/littlest' or 'smaller/smallest'. 'Less' is for amount.

questions.question: Choose the correct comparative form: My new computer is ______ than my old one. (powerful)
questions.explanation: 'Powerful' is a multi-syllable adjective, so use 'more'.
